webpage.para:
The GIMP was part of the Libre Graphics Meeting
held in Lyon from 17th to 19th of March.

section.title: Whats Next: Things to do for GIMP 2.4
SIOX
section.para: There are still performance concerns and features missing with SIOX.

listitem.para: Implement a low resolution preview for large images.
New preview toggle, which temporarily disables the automatic computation for multiple brush strokes for example.
A volunteer for this is needed.

section.title: New Tools
section.para: Sven pointed out that the rectangular and ellipse selection tools should behave similar. The new align tool which is also confusing sometimes. It still behaves to flaky. The code for the Lanczos interpolation is currently broken.
Either fix the Lanczos code or hide it from the 2.4 release by removing it from the UI.

section.title: Googles Summer of Code
section.para: Dave pointed out that the Summer of Code is coming soon were ideas are needed. GIMP is one of the projects which can offer tasks to be solved.
Ideas and Tasks are needed at the beginning of May.

section.title: Preparations for 2.4
section.para: Michael pointed out, that some terms the GIMP UI uses are misleading and very different from other image manipulation programs. One example is the misleading dpi instead of ppi.

Michael proposed a Texttool PDB and also new features: multiple styles for a line of text, more control over text. Unfortunately, GIMP doesn't support currently all pango features. Sometimes Ligature problems with Bitstream Vera Sans occur.

listitem.para: A list of blocker bugs for the 2.4 release is needed.
A string and UI freeze is needed.
Mitchs cleanup should not be commited before 2.4 release.

Volunteers are needed for checking GIMP terms (English and translations). A wiki page should track the termans and also possible translations. One volunteer should elaborate if Rosetta from Ubuntu can be used for this.
A bug is needed for plug-ins which use g_message() and where dialogs pop up behind the main window.
A volunteer is needed for the Texttool PDB.

section.title: Documentation
section.para: The manual currently features nine languages, five are activly worked on. Russian and Norwegian will be added after the 0.10 release. DocBook/XML is a barrier for new contributors, but there is currently no valuable alternative available.
For PDF creation we should use dblatex instead of the dead project db2latex.
The more translation an XML file holds the more difficult it is for contributors to concentrate on their content. Maybe we should split up the content directory-wise instead of profiling.

Michael proposed way users can comment on HTML pages like the PHP documentation. The problems are: what will happen to comments after an update of the documentation, how and who manages comments, which system will suit our needs.

listitem.para: Stick to DocBook/XML for the next year. Be aware of the problems and change to a different internal structure if needed. A new project page should make it easier to contributors to join the project.
Elaborate which issue tracker can lower the barriers for feedback from our readers.

section.title: GEGL
section.para: Pippin pointed out, that GEGL does not yet support calculation over regions of interest. Some of the code that does that is currently 8-bits only, but the reference buffer implementation would be 32bits float per pixel. Yosh proposed to generate all the code needed for this from a template.
Mitch suggested, that the integration of GEGL should be in small steps. The plug-in API should be GEGL only, but will provide backwards compatibility from old plug-ins for 8bits only.
UI and Usability problems are also caused by the indexed mode. We concluded, that it should be available if the user exports his image to an indexed format, like GIF.

listitem.para: Write the 32bits float version first, then generate others from that reference version.

Replace the code in the base directory by GEGL operations. First replace the image map tool (used for color correction, etc.) using GEGL adapters around the pixel buffers. Then later replace the layers.

section.title: How can we Motivate People to Join the GIMP Development?
section.para: The current project page for gimp.org is not really structured and not very easy to get in touch with the developers. The GIMP developers should setup a tasks list in which they consider they are easy to solve and useful for the next version. Some of them can be used for Googles Summer of Code.

listitem.para: Setup a tasks list on the wiki of what can be achieved and implemented. It ranges from easy to very complex tasks. A bug on bugzilla for each task should be filed.
